testCases.question: What are the fees to send 50 EUR?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 50 EUR, you'll pay about [X] EUR in fees, and 50 EUR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: How much does it cost to transfer 100 USD?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 100 USD, you'll pay about [X] USD in fees, and 100 USD will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: Fees for sending 1000 INR?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 1000 INR, you'll pay about [X] INR in fees, and 1000 INR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: What percentage do you charge?
testCases.expectedResponse: Our fees combine fixed and variable components to minimize costs. For a 100 [currency] transfer, this works out to about [X]% effective rate, but larger transfers cost less proportionally.

testCases.question: What's your fee rate for transfers?
testCases.expectedResponse: Our fees combine fixed and variable components to minimize costs. For a 100 [currency] transfer, this works out to about [X]% effective rate, but larger transfers cost less proportionally.

testCases.question: What's the fee to send the EUR equivalent of 50 USD?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send the EUR equivalent of 50 USD (approximately [X] EUR), you'll pay about [Y] EUR in fees, and [X] EUR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: I want to send 100 dollars worth of euros, what's the cost?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send the EUR equivalent of 100 USD (approximately [X] EUR), you'll pay about [Y] EUR in fees, and [X] EUR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: What's the minimum I can send to India?
testCases.expectedResponse: The minimum amount you can send to INR is approximately [X] INR (including fees), which is the equivalent of 1 USD. This minimum applies to international transfers.

testCases.question: What's the minimum transfer amount in EUR?
testCases.expectedResponse: The minimum amount you can send to EUR is approximately [X] EUR (including fees), which is the equivalent of 1 USD. This minimum applies to international transfers.

testCases.question: How much does it cost to add 100 USD to my account?
testCases.expectedResponse: There are no fees when you top up your account with 100 USD—the full amount you deposit goes into your account. There are no fees for any deposit amount, but please note that the maximum you can add is $5,000 and it is the lifetime limit for beta.

testCases.question: Fees for topping up 50 dollars?
testCases.expectedResponse: There are no fees when you top up your account with 50 USD—the full amount you deposit goes into your account. There are no fees for any deposit amount, but please note that the maximum you can add is $5,000 and it is the lifetime limit for beta.

testCases.question: What's the maximum I can deposit?
testCases.expectedResponse: The maximum you can add is $5,000 and it is the lifetime limit for beta. There are no fees when you top up your account—the full amount you deposit goes into your account.

testCases.question: Are there fees for depositing money?
testCases.expectedResponse: There are no fees when you top up your account—the full amount you deposit goes into your account, regardless of the amount. Please note that the maximum you can add is $5,000 and it is the lifetime limit for beta.

testCases.question: What are the fees?
testCases.expectedResponse: To help you with fee information, I need a bit more detail. Are you asking about: 1) Sending money (transfer), or 2) Adding money to your account (top-up)? And if it's a transfer, what amount and which currency?

testCases.question: How much to send money to Europe?
testCases.expectedResponse: To calculate the fees for sending money to Europe, I need to know: What amount would you like to send, and which currency (EUR, GBP, etc.)?

testCases.question: I want to transfer 100
testCases.expectedResponse: I can help you with that! Which currency would you like to send - USD, EUR, GBP, INR, or another currency?

testCases.question: Cost to transfer 75 dollars?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 75 USD, you'll pay about [X] USD in fees, and 75 USD will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: What will I be charged to send 200 EUR to my friend?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 200 EUR, you'll pay about [X] EUR in fees, and 200 EUR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: Fees for sending 25 GBP?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 25 GBP, you'll pay about [X] GBP in fees, and 25 GBP will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: Fees for sending 75 USD worth of INR?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send the INR equivalent of 75 USD (approximately [X] INR), you'll pay about [Y] INR in fees, and [X] INR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: What's the smallest amount I can transfer to Europe?
testCases.expectedResponse: To tell you the minimum transfer amount, I need to know which European currency you're sending to. Are you sending EUR, GBP, or another currency?

testCases.question: Minimum amount for GBP transfers?
testCases.expectedResponse: The minimum amount you can send to GBP is approximately [X] GBP (including fees), which is the equivalent of 1 USD. This minimum applies to international transfers.

testCases.question: Fees for sending 0.50 EUR?
testCases.expectedResponse: The amount you're trying to send (0.50 EUR) is below the minimum transfer amount. The minimum amount you can send is approximately [X] EUR (including fees), which is the equivalent of 1 USD.

testCases.question: What does it cost to send 10000 USD?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 10000 USD, you'll pay about [X] USD in fees, and 10000 USD will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: What's the cost for 1 USD transfer?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 1 USD, you'll pay about [X] USD in fees, and 1 USD will be taken from your account. This is the minimum transfer amount. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: hey how much to send 50 bucks?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 50 USD, you'll pay about [X] USD in fees, and 50 USD will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: quick question - fees for 40 EUR?
testCases.expectedResponse: To send 40 EUR, you'll pay about [X] EUR in fees, and 40 EUR will be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.

testCases.question: Can I add 10000 USD?
testCases.expectedResponse: The maximum you can add is $5,000 and it is the lifetime limit for beta. You cannot deposit 10000 USD as it exceeds this limit. There are no fees when you top up your account—the full amount you deposit goes into your account.

testCases.question: Are your fees flat or percentage-based?
testCases.expectedResponse: Our fees combine fixed and variable components to minimize costs. This means we use both flat and percentage elements. For example, for a 100 [currency] transfer, this works out to about [X]% effective rate, but larger transfers cost less proportionally.

testCases.question: How do your fees work?
testCases.expectedResponse: Our fee structure uses fixed and variable components to minimize costs. For example, for a 100 [currency] transfer, you'd pay about [X] [currency] in fees, and 100 [currency] would be taken from your account. Larger transfers have better rates.
